name: The Perch Resort

reviews.text: These are cabins reminescent of the old teepee motel complexes on Route 66 - very small A-frames, close together, nice inside with a double bed, a single one by the window, and a loft bed. Our cabin had no other furniture, but there is a small front porch with a log bench. Essentially there is room on the floor for a suitcase or two and that's about it.
reviews.title: basic accomodations, nice people

likes.disliked: — the size of the cabins - very small

reviews.text: The same family runs the resort, the Perch restaurant up the hill, and the Pizza place out by the road (which has great pizza and a good vibe). The Perch restaurant is an upscale-for-rural-Alaska place with decent food and a great view. And the hotel price is cheap for Alaska -- we paid $125 for a cabin with private bath, but a bathouse cabin is $85 or so.
reviews.title: Simple cabins away from the corporate mass hotels

likes.liked: — It is a family run business

reviews.title: No thank you!
reviews.text: I was most impressed when my husband left two bottles of prescription medication in the bathroom, one of which was a controlled substance. We called and they mailed both bottles to our home right away, with none missing. This kind of honesty and service counts for a lot, in my opinion.

reviews.text: This is a nice getaway about a 10 minute drive from the big box corporate tourism big sell experience at Denali National Park's entrance.
reviews.title: Great Denali cabin experience!
Great Place to stay
reviews.text: Need a place to stay at Denali National Park in Alaska, this is it. My family and I (a total of 8-four adults and four children stayed at The Perch during our trip of August 2005 (sorry this is a little late). The Perch is a grouping of small little cottages nestled into the beautiful outdoors that the Denali area has to offer. The children stayed in one cottage, ages 17-8 and the adults stayed at another.

reviews.title: Great Value
reviews.text: The childrens cottage was perfect for them having a bed in a loft area along with a bed and sleepable sofa on the main floor. The adults had a cottage that had all of the nessities any hotel offers (two queen size beds). We did request cottages that came with bathrooms. Not all of the cottages have bathrooms. With a gang like ours who are use to hotels it was the best thing. The Perch has a community bathroom for the cottages that do not offer a private bathroom.

reviews.title: not a bad stay
reviews.text: Now for the great part. Grandma Witteman (Frances) made us breakfest every morning. The Perch has a wonderful restaurant (operated by Leslie LeQuire) on top of a hill overlooking the beautiful landscape. The breakfests were all included and wonderful. It was the home touch that made our stay great. Ms LeQuire also made sure our stay was satisfactory.

reviews.title: Awsome Stay
reviews.text: Would we go back-Definately.

reviews.title: Cramped and noisy
reviews.text: The fact is we have sent several relatives there since our visit and they have all enjoyed the stay.

reviews.title: Not what Frommer's Said
reviews.text: We chose The Perch because of the Frommer review. The cabins that were mentioned were not the one they placed us in. We stayed in the cabins that had been described as A-frame and sharing a bathhouse.

reviews.title: Good rooms - not too far from Denali entrance
reviews.text: The cabin was the A-frame. It was very small with a loft. Apparently, the bathroom was added on. The bathroom was extremely small, the shower was tempermental at best.

reviews.title: Terrible place to dine-in
reviews.text: We requested a lunch for the trip into Denali the next day at the pizza place which was recommended. The manager of the restaurant was rude at best.

reviews.title: Very cozy and romantic, but rustic!
reviews.text: I would definitely not recommend this place. The McKinley Creekside Cabins which are next door were less expensive, newer, bigger and very pleasant.

reviews.title: Good humble cabins
reviews.text: We had a comfortable stay. We had the cabins with private bath and two queen beds. I would say the rooms were worth the price and the breakfast was heavenly. Panorama Pizza at the entrance is so good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I completely agree with the person that said that this was the worst restaurant they'd ever been (July 7, 2006). My husband and I had the very same experience. Although, I would have to say that the July reviewer was being kind, when they said the food wasn't great! Besides the fact that they were out of just about everything, when we did get our order, the food was subpar at best. And customer service - non-existent - the staff was nothing but extremely rude. I have never experienced such poor "service." I don't know how they stay in business, but I imagine, it's because they don't have any competition as there is very little to choose from, when you get that close to Denali National Park.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money

reviews.text: Heard about this bed and breakfast, sleeping in cabins, breakfast on the hill, and the awsomeness of nature's song, all were much needed as we took our two night escape from the hustle's of city life.
reviews.title: Reasonable Denali lodging

reviews.text: I had carried their name and phone number in my pocket calendar for over 2 years, passed on to us from some Harley buddies, and had yet to check it out. So as the grindings of day - to - day built up and I was looking for something within a day's drive from Anchorage, Alaska, came across the phone number. Made reservations, which was at the end of season, just prior to potential pipes freezing, had to change them, bumping them back to the last possible openings. We really scored big here!
reviews.title: not terrible, but wouldn't recommend either
Denali Perch Resort- A great place to eat and stay
reviews.text: Several people answered my questions, and were very helpful. We were not disappointed. What a delight to stand in the brisk fall sun, and listen to the stream not twenty feet from the cabin. A step back in time, to a clean, cozy, and warm cabin.

aka: The Perch Hotel Denali National Park And Preserve
